projectDesc.p: To the tune To the tune “Sands of the Washing Stream”—"Outside the Window"is part of The Global Medieval Sourcebook, a digital compendium of medieval texts in their original languages and in English translation. This larger project comprises computer-readable transcriptions and/or editions of texts dating from the ninth to the sixteenth century, and originating in Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, and Asia; accompanied by new English translations; high-resolution digital images of manuscript/early print sources, where available; an apparatus that includes critical introductions, textual notes and annotations; and a flexible user interface with which to navigate these materials.

interpretation.p: Texts are translated into modern English with maximum fidelity to the original text, except where it would impair comprehension or good style. Archaisms are preserved where they do not conflict with the aesthetic of the original text. Creative translation choices are marked and discussed in the critical notes.

app.rdg: To the tune “Sands of the Washing Stream”—"Outside the Window"
Outside the window, the spring color deepens.
The layers of curtains have yet to be rolled up, casting heavy shadows.
Leaning against the building in silence, I played the beautiful zither.
The distant mountains pierce through the clouds, brightening the night.
A gentle breeze blows through the rain, teasing the light clouds, turning the day cloudy.
I am afraid that it is hard to prevent the pear blossoms from withering.
